title: Google reveals NotebookLM app for Android & iPhone, coming at I/O 2025 [Gallery]
description: After teasing last month, Google today unveiled the design of the native NotebookLM app for Android and iPhone users.  more…
author: 9to5Google
excerpt: After teasing last month, Google today unveiled the design of the native NotebookLM app for Android and iPhone users...
text: After teasing last month, Google today unveiled the design of the native NotebookLM app for Android and iPhone users.  The homepage of the mobile app has top tabs for Recent, Shared, Title, and Downloaded. Below that is a list of your notebooks with each card featuring a prominent play button. That should launch the Audio Overview with Google touting background playback and offline support/download. The fullscreen player offers a fun waveform, while you can join the podcast to ask questions and follow-ups of the AI hosts.  There’s a wide “Create new” FAB (floating action button) at the very bottom. Like on the web, you can upload PDFs, websites, YouTube videos, and paste text. NotebookLM will also appear in the system share sheet to quickly add sources. I for one want to read the paper Sundar and Google wrote about Moo Deng Memes When you open a notebook, there’s a bottom bar layout for Sources, Chat, and Studio (tools). It’s similar to the current mobile website. This native experience will replace the PWA (Progressive Web App) for most users. Besides the Android and iPhone design, Google today also shared NotebookLM’s tablet interface. Officially, the NotebookLM app will see a beta launch in the next “few weeks.” The iOS App Store listing says it is expected on May 20, or the first day of I/O 2025. You can pre-register below: Android: Google Play Store (com.google.android.apps.labs.language.tailwind) iOS: App Store More on NotebookLM: NotebookLM Audio Overviews coming to 50+ languages  NotebookLM can now search the web and ‘Discover sources’ for you Google rolls out Mind Maps in NotebookLM, more Add 9to5Google to your Google News feed.  FTC: We use income earning auto affiliate links. More.
html:
After teasing last month, Google today unveiled the design of the native NotebookLM app for Android and iPhone users. 

The homepage of the mobile app has top tabs for Recent, Shared, Title, and Downloaded. Below that is a list of your notebooks with each card featuring a prominent play button. That should launch the Audio Overview with Google touting background playback and offline support/download. The fullscreen player offers a fun waveform, while you can join the podcast to ask questions and follow-ups of the AI hosts. 

There’s a wide “Create new” FAB (floating action button) at the very bottom. Like on the web, you can upload PDFs, websites, YouTube videos, and paste text. NotebookLM will also appear in the system share sheet to quickly add sources.

I for one want to read the paper Sundar and Google wrote about Moo Deng Memes

When you open a notebook, there’s a bottom bar layout for Sources, Chat, and Studio (tools). It’s similar to the current mobile website. This native experience will replace the PWA (Progressive Web App) for most users.

Besides the Android and iPhone design, Google today also shared NotebookLM’s tablet interface.

Officially, the NotebookLM app will see a beta launch in the next “few weeks.” The iOS App Store listing says it is expected on May 20, or the first day of I/O 2025. You can pre-register below:

  • Android: Google Play Store (com.google.android.apps.labs.language.tailwind)
  • iOS: App Store

More on NotebookLM:

  • NotebookLM Audio Overviews coming to 50+ languages 
  • NotebookLM can now search the web and ‘Discover sources’ for you
  • Google rolls out Mind Maps in NotebookLM, more

Add 9to5Google to your Google News feed. 

FTC: We use income earning auto affiliate links. More.
